Created an attachment (id=5910)
an export of my preferences

I can reproduce the problem by importing this preference file on a new
workspace then opening the java>compiler preference page.

This is Linux/GTK problem only. It works fine on Windows and Mac.

There is no need to import the the preferences. On Linux/GTK, opening the
java>compiler preference page on a new workspace generate the problem.

It may be SWT/GTK problem.
It may be relate to bug 39781

Moving to SWT for comments.

Here is what out code does: we create a bunch of check boxes and to identify 
them later we put an id into the data slot. For some reason the widget doesn't 
exist under Linux GTK or it doesn't find the right one.

Luc, do you have another exception in the log which might indicate that the 
widget could not be created.
*** Bug 42301 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Too bad we have this in M3. It happens in a new workspace as well.
A bad change in the Combo cause it to send Selection events when the API 
setText is called.

This is fixed in HEAD > 20030902.
*** Bug 42446 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Was this fix supposed to be in the 20030903 build?
